content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 1664 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(1664 m^2\)
Therefore, \(1664 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{1664}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{16}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 4 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

hint.text: Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2 (lb + bh + lh)\)

solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (30 \times 20 + 20 \times 11 + 30 \times 11) = 2300 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 1.8 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(2300 \times 1.8\)
= Rs. 4140

content.text: Latika needs to paint a rectangular box from the outside. The cost of painting the box is Rs. 1.8 per \(cm^2.\) If the dimensions of the box are \(30 cm \times 20 cm \times 11 cm\), what is the total cost of painting the box?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area

solution.text:
Curved Surface area of the roller \(= 2 \pi rh = 2\pi \times \frac {10}2 \times 38 = 1194.29 cm^2\)
Area covered per rotation \(= 1194.29 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area painted in 56 rolls \(= 1194.29 \times 56 = 66880 cm^2\)

content.text: Last Monday, Ram painted a rectangular wall with a cylindrical paint roller. The length of the roller is 38 cm and its diameter is 10 cm. While painting, the roller rolled over 56 times completely. What surface area did Ram paint?

hint.text: How much area does the roller cover in one rotation?

solution.text:
Area of tin sheet required for 1 box = Surface area of one box
\(= 2 (9 \times 3 + 3 \times 6 + 9 \times 6) = 198 cm^2\)
Therefore, area of tin required for 12 boxes \(= 198 \times 12\)
\(= 2376 cm^2\)

content.text: You need to create a tin box of dimensions \(9 cm \times 3 cm \times 6 cm.\) What is the area of a sheet of tin required to make 12 such tins?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area of the box

solution.text: Surface Area of a cube = \(6 \times length^2 = 216 cm^2\)

content.text: See the cube below, a=6 cm, Find its surface area

solution.text: Surface Area of a cuboid = \(2(ab + bc + ca) = 2 (1458 + 486 + 972) = 5832 dm^2\)

content.text: See the cuboid below, a=54 dm, b=27 dm, c=18 dm, Find its surface area

solution.text: Surface Area of a cylinder = \(2 \times \pi \times r \times(r + h) = 1672 cm^2\)

content.text: In the cylinder below, diameter=28 cm, h=5 cm, find its surface area

solution.text:
Surface Area = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2\pi ({r_ o}^2 - {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 2112 + 1584 + 176 = 3872 cm^2\)

content.text: In the hollow cylinder below, Inner Radius =6 cm, Outer Radius = 8 cm, Height = 42 cm, find its surface area
Find the surface area of the objects below:

hint.text:
Remember the following formulas:
Surface Area of the Cube:\( 6 \times side^2\)
Surface Area of the Cuboid: \(2 \times (lb + bh + lh)\)
Surface area of a cylinder:\(2\pi r(r+h)\)

solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 2.3^2 = 158.7 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(2.3^2 cm^2 = 5.29 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 158.7 - 52.9 = 105.8 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 16 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(105.8 \times 16\)
= Rs. 1692.8

content.text: Five cubes of edge 2.3 cm each are placed side by side and stuck together as shown. The cost of painting is Rs 16 per \(cm^2\). What is the cost of painting the outer surface of the entire object?

hint.text: Count the number of faces that are outward facing

solution.text:
Total surface area \(= 1734= 6 (side)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Length of side = \( \left(\sqrt {\frac {1734}{6}} \right) = 17 cm\)

content.text: A closed box in the shape of a cube has a total outer surface area of 1734 \(cm^2.\) What is the length of its side in centimetres?

hint.text: Remember that surface area of a cube is \(6 \times side^2\)
